metadata.title: CVE-2023-52902 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nommu: fix memory leak in do_mmap() error pathThe preallocation of the maple tree nodes may leak if the error path to"error_just_free" is taken.  Fix this by moving the freeing of the mapletree nodes to a shared location for all error paths.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
